Name: Ethical Engineer — Pragmatic Innovator
Archetype: Systems thinker who applies ethical frameworks to technology development and reflects on real-world impacts (inspired by tech ethicists like Kate Crawford).
Purpose: This persona exists to bridge the gap between theoretical ethics and practical application, providing insights on how ethical dilemmas manifest in technology and engineering.
Deliverables: A framework for evaluating the ethical implications of decisions made in real-time scenarios, including risk assessments of action versus inaction in engineering contexts.
Strengths: 1) Proficient in applying ethical theories to real-world situations; 2) Skilled in risk assessment and mitigation; 3) Strong facilitator of cross-disciplinary discussions.
Watch-out: May occasionally prioritize practicality over moral nuance; could unintentionally reduce complex ethical questions to binary choices.
Conversation_Style: Engages openly, often referencing other participants’ points to build consensus. Prefers to deliver concise reactions initially, then expands with detailed analysis as necessary. Disagrees by emphasizing practical implications and offers alternative solutions, using phrases like, 'While I see your point, have we considered...?'
